Package edu.umn.nlpie.mtap.model

Interface Label

All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericLabel
public interface Label
An interface for a span of text that has been determined to have some specific meaning or function.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default int compareLocation​(@NotNull Label other)
    Compares this label to another label by their locations, i.e.
    default int compareStart​(@NotNull Label other)
    Compares this label to another label by their start indices.
    default boolean covers​(int startIndex, int endIndex)
    Whether the span of text covered by this label includes the span of text starting at startIndex and ending at endIndex.
    default boolean covers​(@NotNull Label other)
    Whether the span of text covered by this label includes the span of text covered by the other label.
    @Nullable Document getDocument()
    The document that the label appears on.
    int getEndIndex()
    Exclusive end index.
    int getStartIndex()
    The index of the first character included in the label.
    default @NotNull java.lang.String getText()
    Retrieves the portion of the document text covered by this label.

    Whether this label is inside the span starting with startIndex and ending with endIndex.

    Returns the length (in number of characters) of the Label.
    default boolean locationEquals​(@NotNull Label other)

  • Method Details

    • getDocument

      @Nullable @Nullable Document getDocument()
      The document that the label appears on.
      Returns:
      A document object or null.

    • getStartIndex

      int getStartIndex()
      The index of the first character included in the label.
      Returns:
      Integer index.

    • getEndIndex

      int getEndIndex()
      Exclusive end index. The index of the first character not included after the label.
      Returns:
      Integer index.

    • getText

      @NotNull default @NotNull java.lang.String getText()
      Retrieves the portion of the document text covered by this label.
      Returns:
      A string of the document text covered by the label.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this label doesn't have an associated document it will fail.

    • length

      default int length()
      Returns the length (in number of characters) of the Label.
      Returns:
      Integer length of the label.

    • locationEquals

      default boolean locationEquals​(@NotNull @NotNull Label other)
      Whether the span of text covered by this label is the same as the span of text covered by the other label.
      Parameters:
      other - The other label to check for location equivalence.
      Returns:
      true if the other label's location equals the location of this label, false otherwise.

    • covers

      default boolean covers​(int startIndex, int endIndex)
      Whether the span of text covered by this label includes the span of text starting at startIndex and ending at endIndex.
      Parameters:
      startIndex - The start index of the text.
      endIndex - The end index of the text.
      Returns:
      true if the span is covered by this label, false otherwise.

    • covers

      default boolean covers​(@NotNull @NotNull Label other)
      Whether the span of text covered by this label includes the span of text covered by the other label.
      Parameters:
      other - The other label to check.
      Returns:
      true if the other label's location is inside the location of this label, false otherwise.

    • isInside

      default boolean isInside​(int startIndex, int endIndex)
      Whether this label is inside the span starting with startIndex and ending with endIndex.
      Parameters:
      startIndex - The start index inclusive of the span.
      endIndex - The end index exclusive of the span.
      Returns:
      true if this label is inside the span.

    • compareLocation

      default int compareLocation​(@NotNull @NotNull Label other)
      Compares this label to another label by their locations, i.e. first by start index then by end index.
      Parameters:
      other - The other label.
      Returns:
      Result of two natural order comparisons, first of the start indices, then if start indices are the same of the end indices.

    • compareStart

      default int compareStart​(@NotNull @NotNull Label other)
      Compares this label to another label by their start indices.
      Parameters:
      other - The other label.
      Returns:
      Natural ordering comparison value.
